posts.name: Cardin Nguyen
posts.cooked:
When going through all our REV products and ensuring they’re updated and ID correctly, I came across a PDH being shown as a pneumatic hub in the hardware client, and nothing else is plugged in to the computer. I unplugged, plugged the path from the computer, tried different ports, restarted the computer, restarted the client, etc, and it would still show up as a pneumatic hub and I got no idea how to fix it.

IMG_8902 1920×1440 222 KB

IMG_8902 1920×1440 222 KB

IMG_8902 1920×1440 222 KB

posts.name: Dilpreet Singh Randhawa
posts.cooked:
If there ever was a slam dunk scenario to email REV support, I think this is it.

https://www.revrobotics.com/contact-us/

posts.name: Cardin Nguyen
posts.cooked: I was thinking about it, but I was wondering if anyone had any ideas before I do. Thank you!

posts.name: Jon Stratis
posts.cooked: I wonder if recovery mode might help? Power Distribution Hub Troubleshooting - Power Distribution Hub

link_counts.title: Power Distribution Hub Troubleshooting - Power Distribution Hub

posts.name: bobbysq
posts.cooked: That’s what I was thinking. Seems like it got flashed with the wrong firmware at some point, so it might be possible to flash the correct firmware and get it working correctly again.

posts.name: Noah Andrews
posts.cooked: Since It’s possible to flash different types of firmware from recovery mode, it was probably placed in recovery mode at some point, and then Pneumatic Hub firmware was flashed onto it. Like @bobbysq said, putting it back in recovery mode and flashing the PDH firmware will probably fix you up.

posts.name: Cardin Nguyen
posts.cooked: I assume that was the case. Thank you @bobbysq , @NoahAndrews , @Jon_Stratis , and @DRandhawa for your help! I’ll try putting it in recovery and reflashing once I get the chance.

posts.name: Cardin Nguyen
posts.cooked: So, update on the situation; we threw the pdh (the same one that got flashed into a pneumatic hub) into our practice robot, and oddly got a CAN fault error on all our spark maxes (and tested through the hardware client), and when plugging a laptop into our pdh, it went into recovery mode - even though I had already flashed the correct firmware onto it, and I did the reasonable thing and flashed the firmware onto the pdh again, and after when it restarted, it showed up in recovery mode again, like in a loop. I have a video of it doing as I’m describing but I’m not allowed to upload it apparently

posts.name: Noah Andrews
posts.cooked: Hmm, sorry to hear that. Please email REV support at support @revrobotics.com .

posts.name: Cardin Nguyen
posts.cooked: Thank you for your help, I currently have an ongoing email with a specialist.
